mods.abstract: RUNAWAY IN JAIL. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 5th day of November instant, a negroman, calling himself THOMAS or TOM, aged about 25 years, six feet, seven inches high, he has a white swelling on the left leg and says that he had a wart on the tongue. Thomas or Tom says he belongs to Mr. A. Mathews, residing on Bayou TÃªche, in the Parish of St. Landry, from whom he runaway about three weeks. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. LOUIS L. BOUTTE, Jailor. Opelousas, November 11th., 1854.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
